main.sys
Class Resonator

java.lang.Object
  main.sys.Resonator

public class Resonator
extends java.lang.Object

The Resonator class contains an ArrayList on optical elements and has methods for working on those elements. The round trip matrix can be calculated for the resonator from the contained objects and their order. In addition, the number of dimensions (or directions) is arbitrary.

isStable

public boolean isStable(int dim)
Calculates the imaginary part of the round trip matrix to find if it is stable.

Parameters:

Returns:
If the resonator is stable in the specified dimension.

addABCD

public void addABCD(ABCD mat,
                    int index,
                    int dim)
Method to as optical elements to the resonator.

Parameters:
mat - The ABCD matrix object to add.
index - The index location to add the matrix to, note that if an matrix exists in the index, it will be moved back to accommodate.
dim - The dimension to add the matrix to.

Returns:
The ABCD matrix object for the specified index and dimension.

getRTMat

public ABCD getRTMat(int dim)
Round trip matrix getter, recalculates the matrix for the resonator first.

Parameters:
dim - The dimension to retrieve the round trip matrix from.
Returns:
The round trip matrix of the resonator for the specified direction.
